newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Koor profit hurt by Israeli economy.
newsitem.headline: Koor profit hurt by Israeli economy.

text.p: Koor Industries Ltd, Israel's biggest conglomerate, said on Wednesday a deteriorating economy and doubts about the peace process contributed to an almost 10 percent decline in net profit in the third quarter.

Koor's revenues were up just 3.3 percent in the third quarter from a year earlier to $844.0 million, while operating income declined 14.9 percent to $54.9 million and net profit dropped 9.6 percent to $31.3 million.

"Our economy is still affected by high interest rates and the increasing gap between the inflation rate and the exchange rate of the Israeli shekel against the U.S. dollar," said Benjamin Gaon, Koor's president and chief executive officer.
"At the same time uncertainties in the peace process dominate the political environment," he said in a statement.

Despite an unfavourable exchange rate environment, Koor said it increased group exports in the first nine months of the year by 10.7 percent in dollar terms. Because of the real appreciation of the Israeli shekel, however, exports in shekel terms rose only 7.1 percent.
Koor estimated the difference cost it revenues of about 100 million shekels.
